Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Pastor Janet Hodge Sr. Pastor at Crawford  Memorial United Methodist, 3757 White Plains Rd., Bronx N.Y. 10467.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member King.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Pastor Janet Hodge, Pastor at Crawford Memorial United Methodist, 3757 White Plains Road, Bronx, N.Y. 10467.

Council Member King moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 27, 2017 be adopted as printed by Council Member Chin.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Chin moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 27, 2017 be adopted as printed.

Report of the Committee on Environmental Protection
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a long-term energy plan for the city and establishing a New York city energy policy advisory subcommittee
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Creating a long-term energy plan for the city and establishing a NYC energy policy advisory subcommittee.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the eligible funds exemption for veterans
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Eligible funds exemption for veterans.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation to require all real property conveyances to be memorialized by a deed recorded in the office of the clerk of the county where such real property is situated.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Finance
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Require all real property conveyances to be memorialized by a deed recorded in the office of the clerk of the county where such real property is situated.

Items.Title:
RESOLUTION AMENDING AND RESTATING THE RESOLUTION TO PROVIDE THE AMOUNTS NECESSARY FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE GOVERNMENT OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK AND THE COUNTIES THEREIN AND FOR THE PAYMENT OF INDEBTEDNESS THEREOF, FOR THE FISCAL YEAR
BEGINNING ON JULY 1, 2017 AND ENDING ON JUNE 30, 2018, BY THE LEVY OF TAXES ON THE REAL PROPERTY IN THE CITY OF NEW YORK, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THE CONSTITUTION OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, THE REAL PROPERTY TAX LAW AND THE CHARTER OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: The support of the government of the city of New York and the counties therein and for the payment of indebtedness thereof, for the fiscal year.

Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to amend the Penal Law Section 130.05 to include individuals in police custody as being categorically incapable of consenting to sexual conduct with a police officer.

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).


There were 47 Council Members present at this Stated Meeting.




There is presently a vacant seat in the Council pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of the General Election held in the 28th Council Distict (Quuens) on November 7, 2017.

Items.Title: Application No. 20175287 TCM pursuant to Section 20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of KioRestaurant, LLC, d/b/a KHE-YO, for a revocable consent to establish, maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 157 Duane Street, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 1, Council District 1. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 20-226 of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
